gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.q1: How do I add a recipe?
gettingStarted.a1: Tap the +Add Recipe button in the header. You can either paste a URL from your favorite recipe site to import it automatically, or add a recipe manually by typing in the details.
gettingStarted.a2: Paste any recipe URL and we will try to extract the title, ingredients, and instructions automatically. Works with most major recipe sites. If import fails, you can always add the recipe manually.
gettingStarted.q3: How do I plan my weekly meals?
gettingStarted.a3: Go to the Schedule tab (calendar icon) to see your weekly view. Tap + Add on any lunch or dinner slot to pick a recipe from your library.

recipes.title: Recipes & Library
recipes.q1: How do I edit a recipe?
recipes.a1: Open any recipe from the library, then tap the pencil icon in the top bar to edit its details.
recipes.q2: What does the color badge mean?
recipes.a2: Green = cooked recently (last 7 days), Yellow = getting stale (14-30 days), Red = needs rotation (30+ days), Gray = never cooked.
recipes.q3: How do I search and filter recipes?
recipes.a3: Use the search bar at the top of the library to filter by recipe name or ingredient. Use the sort dropdown to order by oldest cooked, newest, or alphabetical.
recipes.a4: When adding or editing a recipe, type a tag name and press Enter or comma to add it. Use the tag filter chips in the library to quickly filter recipes by tag.

dataPrivacy.title: Data & Privacy
dataPrivacy.a1: All your data is stored locally in your browser using IndexedDB. Nothing is sent to any server.
dataPrivacy.q2: How do I back up my data?
dataPrivacy.a2: Go to Settings, then Data Management, then Export. This downloads a JSON file with all your recipes and schedule entries.
dataPrivacy.q3: How do I restore from a backup?
dataPrivacy.a3: Go to Settings, then Data Management, then Import. Select your backup JSON file. You can choose to replace all data or merge with existing data.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.a1: Some websites block automatic imports. Make sure the URL is correct, try a different recipe, or use manual entry as a fallback.
troubleshooting.q2: My data seems to have disappeared
troubleshooting.a2: Data is stored in your browser. Clearing browser data or using incognito mode will reset it. We recommend regular backups via Settings.
troubleshooting.q3: The app is not working properly
troubleshooting.a3: Try refreshing the page. If the problem persists, clear the site data in your browser settings and restore from a backup.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.intro: Fork and Spoon is a web application that helps you track and plan meals. Your privacy is important to us. This policy explains how we handle your data, both locally and in the cloud.

dataStorage.title: Data Storage
dataStorage.content: All your data (recipes, meal plans, preferences) is stored locally in your browser using IndexedDB. No data is sent to or stored on any external server.

noAccounts.title: No Accounts Required
noAccounts.content: Fork and Spoon does not require you to create an account, provide an email address, or any personal information to use the app.

recipeImport.title: Recipe Import
recipeImport.content: When you import a recipe via URL, a request is made to fetch the page content. This request may go through a CORS proxy to access the recipe data. No personal data is included in these requests.

cookies.title: Cookies & Tracking
cookies.content: We do not use cookies for tracking. The app may use localStorage to save your language preference and other settings. No analytics or tracking scripts are included.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Services
thirdParty.content: The app may use a CORS proxy service for recipe imports. No other third-party services are used. No data is shared with advertisers or analytics providers.

dataControl.title: Your Data, Your Control
dataControl.content: You can export all your data as JSON at any time via Settings. You can delete all data by clearing your browser site data. We recommend regular backups.

contact.title: Contact
contact.content: For questions about this privacy policy, please open an issue on our GitHub repository.

cloudSync.title: Cloud Sync & Accounts
cloudSync.content: When you create an account, your recipes and meal plans are stored in Supabase (a cloud database) to enable multi-device sync and household sharing. Your data is encrypted in transit and at rest. Only members of your household can access your shared recipes and schedules. You can choose to use the app without an account (local-only mode), in which case no data leaves your device.

publicSharing.title: Public Recipe Sharing
publicSharing.content: When you share a recipe via a public link, that recipe becomes accessible to anyone with the link. Public recipe pages display the recipe title, ingredients, instructions, tags, and source URL. No personal information (your name, email, or household details) is included on public recipe pages. You can stop sharing a recipe at any time.
